title._content: Gathering at monument marking explorer's camp

description._content: Group of people gathered around monument erected by RAHS to mark camping place of Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson at Glenbrook on 12 May 1813. Man with hand on monument appears to be addressing the crowd while girl in foreground shields face from camera. This image is part of a collection entitled ‘Blue Mountains Excursions', which is available to view on the Royal Australian Historical Society's Historypin Channel. Access the collection at the following link: www.historypin.com/channels/view/id/48441/#|collections/v... Please feel free to comment on this or any of the other images in the collection. If you have more accurate information regarding the location and/or date of the image, we would love to hear from you!
